article.headline: SE Louisiana 65, Lamar 53
article.story: BEAUMONT, Texas (AP) -- Amir Abdur-Rahim scored 33 points, including eight 3-pointers, as Southeastern Louisiana defeated Lamar 65-53 Wednesday night. Southeastern Louisiana (11-4, 3-1 Southland) gained the lead for good on a layup by Jonathan Walker with 3:54 remaining in the first half and led 32-27 at halftime. The Lions outscored Lamar 16-2 in the opening minutes of the second half to take a 48-29 lead. Lamar (7-9, 1-3) cut the lead to 57-49 on a free throw by Teddy Davis at the 5:13 mark, but Abdur-Rahim then hit his school-record eighth 3-pointer and the Cardinals didn't threaten again. Jason Grant scored 14 points to lead Lamar and Terrell Petteway added 12. Nate Lofton had 21 rebounds and four assists for Southeastern Louisiana.
